features: S PEN INCLUDED: Unleash your creativity and never miss a note with S Pen; Use for drawing, jot notes, edit photos, and convert your handwritten notes to text; Plus, S Pen attaches magnetically right to your tablet so it’s always ready to go

ENTERTAINMENT READY: The shows and games you love look epic with Galaxy Tab S6 Lite; Never miss a second of gaming action with our latest processor and see every detail with a crystal-clear screen; Dolby Atmos surround sound draws you into the experience
LONG LASTING BATTERY: Go ahead: crush your favorite shows for hours, then head to work for a full day of meetings; This battery will keep up – going up to 13 hours* on a single charge

SLIM METAL DESIGN: The slim and lightweight build slips right into your bag, making it easy to take everywhere; Make the sleek, stylish frame all your own and choose from distinctive, expressive colors to show the world your personality and style

MULTI DEVICE CONNECTIVITY: Own your work and play with Galaxy connectivity; Get more done on an expanded workstation that lets you hand off content between your devices and open multiple windows on your tablet

DeX EXPERIENCE: Get more done each day by turning your Galaxy devices into an expanded desktop workstation; Send multiple windows to the devices of your choice and control them all from your Galaxy Tab S6 Lite like a boss**

CONNECT & CAPTURE: Interact with the world through the Galaxy Tab S6 Lite; The 8MP rear camera is equipped with autofocus—ideal for recording, capturing and sharing everything; Video chat with friends and family on the 5MP front-facing camera

TAKE THE VIEW WITH YOU: With the Samsung Smart View app, you can send content from your tablet to a nearby Samsung TV*** to enjoy on the big screen; If you step away from the TV, take the action with you and continue watching from your tablet
ROOM FOR EVERYTHING: Store all of your content with built-in 64GB / 128GB internal memory. Expand your storage space anytime up to 1TB with a microSD card****
YOUR WORLD AT A GLANCE: Your tablet screen works for you, even when it’s charging; Choose between different board functions to show your weekly calendar or the weather on your lock screen

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent tablet for artists, students, and anyone else who needs a tablet!
reviews.reviewText: This tablet has become something I happily use every day. I've been trying to get into digital art, and I've tried both screenless tablets that connect to a computer as well as a cheaper Lenovo tablet with a stylus. Neither of those devices compares to the Galaxy Tab S6 Lite.** S-PEN **If you're getting this tablet, you are almost definitely interested in the S-Pen. I'd call it the most important feature of this tablet.The S-Pen is in a class of its own; it feels incredibly natural and smooth to use. I wouldn't call it quite like paper, since there is a very small input lag. However, it is still a joy to use, as that input lag is only noticeable when you're looking for it. I only notice it because I've used more expensive Samsung and Apple tablets before with higher refresh rate displays. If you've never used one of those before, you will absolutely not notice that input lag.I also appreciate the magnetic attachment ability the S-Pen has; hopefully that'll make it harder to lose the pen! The Lenovo tablet I had beforehand did not have this feature, which caused me to almost lose the pen once or twice. Also, this pen does not need to be charged, ever. It is powered simply by hovering it over the screen like a Wacom tablet (and, in fact, it is the exact same technology, presumably licensed from Wacom itself). And if you're wondering, it does have a laminated screen, so there is no gap between where the pen touches and the actual pixels on the display. The iPad (not Air/Pro) does not have this hardware feature, which is very important to how the pen feels to use.** General Performance **This tablet has a Snapdragon 732G (yes, the documentation says 720G but all apps will detect a 732G so that's what I'm going with; it also doesn't make a huge difference), which performs great considering the price. All drawing apps I've used aside from Krita (which is definitely not optimized for Android anyway) perform perfectly fine, even with many layers. OneNote, which I use for note-taking, also works very well. An interesting quirk is that when using Samsung Notes, the S-Pen has close to zero input lag, so there's probably some extra optimization there.I can't really speak for gaming, since that's not what I use this for, but I would not expect it to be great. But for regular use and some light multitasking (the multi-window feature is very useful), it performs incredibly well!** Battery **This unit has a 7040 mAh battery, which I actually thought was small for a tablet, but it's quite good in reality. With my usage, the battery lasts somewhere between 4 to 7 days. This is comprised mainly of youtube, web browsing, drawing, note-taking, etc. It also has a very minimal idle drain, meaning that if you don't use it and leave it in sleep mode, it sips very little power. Most smartphones aren't great at this, but this tablet has no issues conserving power when not in use. In summary, I would say battery life is a non-issue for this device!** Software **This comes with Samsung's OneUI 4.1 and recently got updated to OneUI 5.0. OneUI has a lot of pros and a lot of cons. The pros are mainly that it is full of features; anything you want, OneUI has it hidden away somewhere. I've never felt like I needed a feature that wasn't present here. With that, of course, comes all of the bloatware. There are a lot of apps pre-installed with this, such as Samsung Kids, or Galaxy Store, PENUP, and a few others. It's definitely not as bad as it could be. All of the extra apps are at least Samsung apps, there are no third-party games or anything here, but it's still a little annoying. Some of them can be disabled.Customization is great, it has most of what Android 12/13 has by default with a few extras tossed in by Samsung. Overall, I'm mostly a fan of it, and Samsung has been getting better with their update speed as well.** Final Thoughts/Hardware **I'm very happy with this purchase. Since I got it on sale, it was very good value for the money. A couple notes about the hardware: it's surprisingly thin; comparing it again to my previous Lenovo tablet, this was at least a couple mm thinner. It's also very light for its size. The cameras are nothing worth talking about, they just work and take photos/video. The front camera is OK for video calls, but again, nothing that great. Same story with the speakers, they didn't wow me, but they sound good enough and get loud enough. The Galaxy Tab S6 Lite is overall something I'd recommend to anyone looking for a tablet between $200 and $300. I don't think there's anything better than this in this price range, and it honestly might be able to compete at the $300-$400 level as well. I have essentially no complaints about it and nothing but praise for the S-Pen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing for the price! Art tablet/digital notebook/eReader all in one
reviews.reviewText: I love this thing to death, I've used it every day since I got it. It does everything I needed for a fraction of the price of anything else in this vein in could find. I use it for digital painting, journaling, planning, scrapbooking, photo editing, reading and listening to books, browsing the net, etc. It's a very comfortable middle ground between my laptop (Lenovo Yoga) and phone (Galaxy Note 20). The out of box stylus is simple with only one button, but does not need charging which is nice for extended use. The tablet itself has a very good battery, lasts all day. The display is LCD as opposed to AMOLED which I would have preferred but the quality is still good. Very good speakers, better than my phone but not as good as my JBL Go. With apps like Cubasis on the market you can even use the tablet as a starting point for audio projects to be finished on a PC through midi track export, recording, etc. The integration between Samsung devices is good, I can wirelessly transfer any files between my phone and tablet and the Galaxy buds work with both. This tablet is not as fancy or graphically capable as my girlfriend's iPad, but with my phone as a companion to it I really don't even need all those extra features. All in all, completely worth the price point, I have no regrets. I love this thing and tell my friends and co-workers who are students or do graphic design about it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab S6 Lite: A School Essential in Chiffon Rose
reviews.reviewText: The SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab S6 Lite 10.4" 64GB Tablet has proven to be an invaluable companion in my academic journey, combining sleek design, powerful features, and the convenience of the included S Pen to elevate my school experience. As a student, this tablet has become an essential tool that seamlessly integrates into my daily educational routine.The standout feature of the Galaxy Tab S6 Lite is its 10.4" LCD screen, which provides a vibrant and immersive display. Whether I'm reading textbooks, taking notes, or watching educational videos, the crisp visuals and vibrant colors enhance the learning experience. The size strikes a perfect balance between portability and usability, allowing me to carry it effortlessly from class to class.The inclusion of the S Pen adds a layer of versatility that goes beyond traditional note-taking. The responsiveness and precision of the stylus make it an ideal tool for annotating PDFs, sketching diagrams, and jotting down ideas. The seamless integration of the S Pen into the tablet's design enhances productivity, making it an invaluable asset for various academic tasks.The slim metal design not only contributes to the tablet's aesthetic appeal but also ensures durability. The tablet feels solid in hand, and its lightweight nature further facilitates easy transportation. The Chiffon Rose color adds a touch of elegance, setting it apart from more generic devices and allowing me to personalize my tech setup.Academic productivity is further enhanced by the powerful AKG dual speakers, providing clear and immersive audio for video lectures and multimedia content. The 8MP rear camera is a handy addition for capturing whiteboard notes or snapping reference photos for study purposes.Battery life is a crucial consideration for any student, and the Galaxy Tab S6 Lite excels in this department. Its long-lasting battery ensures that I can go through a full day of classes without worrying about running out of power.In conclusion, the SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab S6 Lite 10.4" 64GB Android Tablet in Chiffon Rose has become an indispensable tool for my academic pursuits. Its sleek design, immersive display, S Pen functionality, and long-lasting battery make it the perfect companion for school-related tasks. Highly recommended for students who prioritize both style and functionality in their educational devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good value Tablet on sale
reviews.reviewText: Bought it for 370 SGD on sale. I have seen prices as low as 330 SGD. At that price, this tablet is very worth it. Plus this is the 2022 version with updated snapdragon processor as it is the US model. Pen works very well so far and battery life is excellent.
